text: American Samoa competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== American Samoa entered two swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Micah Masei |align=left|50 m freestyle |24.05 |73 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:05.24 |67 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Tilali Scanlan |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:16.03 |45 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m breaststroke |2:52.56 |32 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:American Samoa at the World Aquatics Championships Category:2019 in American Samoan sports
title: American Samoa at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
